articles.title: Thousands of Americans voluntarily self-quarantine after returning from China
articles.description: Thousands of Americans are under voluntary self-quarantine after travel to China, monitoring for symptoms of the coronavirus for 14 days.

articles.title: Coronavirus quarantine on Diamond Princess cruise ship 'chaotic,' Japanese expert claims
articles.description: Coronavirus quarantine measures on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship were completely chaotic, Japanese infectious disease specialist Kentaro Iwata said.
articles.content:
The novel coronavirus quarantine measures put in place by Japanese officials on board a cruise ship where thousands of people have been kept in isolation were completely chaotic, an infectious disease specialist who visited the vessel has claimed.

articles.title: Asian American teen in L.A. assaulted over coronavirus
articles.description: "Children unfortunately repeat things that are said by other people, including their own parents, so we need to put a stop to that," L.A. County Supervisor Hilda Solis said.
articles.content:
A 16-year-old Los Angeles County student was allegedly assaulted last week amid fears over the new coronavirus.

articles.title: Amid coronavirus outbreak, some Americans are attempting the journey back home to Wuhan

articles.title: Coronavirus may be detectable before symptoms start
articles.description: Does coronavirus spread without symptoms? A new paper offers insights, but no firm conclusion can be drawn, say experts. Passengers on the Diamond Princess cruise ship can't go back to the U.S. for 14 more days.
articles.content:
Tests can detect the new coronavirus in people before they show symptoms, though it's still unclear whether a person can spread it to others at this point, while they are asymptomatic, a study published Tuesday says.

articles.title: China revokes three Wall Street Journal reporters' credentials
articles.description: China has revoked the press credentials of three journalists of the Wall Street Journal after the newspaper declined to apologize for a column with a headline calling China the “real sick man of Asia”, the foreign ministry said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Cruise ship passengers leave as two-week coronavirus quarantine ends, more cases confirmed
articles.description: Some of the passengers on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship in Yokohama, Japan, disembarked on Feb. 19 after coronavirus had infected more than 540 people on board and led to a two-week quarantine.
